message.content:
cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CY, cs.CR

Reasoning: 
1. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper discusses the importance of large-scale datasets in communication network design and how understanding human mobility can help contain the spread of epidemics. This aligns with the focus of the cs.SI sub-category.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the lack of large-scale mobility data in the wireless and mobile research community and poses a challenge to collect such data. This aligns with the focus of the cs.NI sub-category.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the design and construction of mobile systems and algorithms, which aligns with the focus of the cs.SY sub-category.
4. cs.CY (Computers and Society) - The paper discusses how planet-scale mobility measurements can impact fundamental studies in other academic disciplines and how it can help save the world. This aligns with the focus of the cs.CY sub-category.
5. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - Although not the main focus of the paper, the discussion of tracking and modeling the spread of epidemics could potentially involve privacy and security concerns, which aligns with the focus of the cs.CR sub-category.
